member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType
member.summary: Conditional format rule type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.CellValue
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule compares a cell value to a formula calculated result, using an operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.Expression
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule contains a formula to evaluate. When the formula result is true, the cell is highlighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.ColorScale
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule creates a gradated color scale on the cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.DataBar
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule displays a gradated data bar in the range of cells.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.IconSet
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule applies icons to cells according to their values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.Top10
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells whose values fall in the top N or bottom N bracket, as specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.UniqueValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights unique values in the range.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.DuplicateValues
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights duplicated values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.ContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing given text. Equivalent to using the SEARCH() sheet function to determine whether the cell contains the text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.NotContainsText
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.BeginsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells in the range that begin with the given text. Equivalent to using the LEFT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.EndsWith
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells ending with given text. Equivalent to using the RIGHT() sheet function and comparing values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.ContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are completely blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.NotContainsBlanks
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are not blank. Equivalent of using LEN(TRIM()). This means that if the cell contains only characters that TRIM() would remove, then it is considered blank. An empty cell is also considered blank.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.ContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells with formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.NotContainsErrors
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells without formula errors. Equivalent to using ISERROR() sheet function to determine if there is a formula error.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.TimePeriod
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells containing dates in the specified time period. The underlying value of the cell is evaluated, therefore the cell does not need to be formatted as a date to be evaluated. For example, with a cell containing the value 38913 the conditional format shall be applied if the rule requires a value of 7/14/2006.

member.name: F:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.FormatConditionType.AboveAverage
member.summary: This conditional formatting rule highlights cells that are above or below the average for all values in the range.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell
member.summary: Encapsulates the object that represents a single grid cell.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.SetCellValue(System.Object)
member.summary: If the value is a formula,this method set cell's value as FormulaType, but not calculate formula. To calculate formula,need call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas manually. If multi values to be set,call this method multi times, finally,call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas method manually to calculate formulas. This is more effective. It will not auto calculate formulas in any case even GridDesktop.RecalculateFormulas is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a cell value. If value is formula, the set method of this property will call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas method automatic if GridDesktop.RecalculateFormulas property is true. So, if there are many formulas, using SetCellValue method instead of this property. SetCellValue method will enhance performance. If GridDesktop.RecalculateFormulas property is false, it will not call GridDesktop.RunAllFormulas.

member.summary: Read only,to set formula,use Value set attribute. If cell value is not a formula,returns null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridCell.Protected
member.summary: Indicates if the cell is protected. If the value is "true", user can not modify the cell through the user interface. This attribute has nothing to do with the Style.CellLocked property and will not be saved to file when grid data exported. The default value is "false".

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.GridDesktop.AlwasysRecalculateAllFormulas
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we need to run all formulas,as when we run all formulas, when update one cell value,and it affect others ,and others affect others ,more and more, cause the whole cells need recalculate ,just like the Butterfly Effect,it needs lots of stack opertation , it will get very low performance, like in CELLSNET-41921,this issue contains the very file that can show this scenario we'd better just run all formulas, ,as when run all formulas we may have some optimization.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.summary: Removes the first occurrence of a specific sheet from the WorksheetCollection. If the specific sheet is the last sheet,after removes sheet,will add a new sheet to the WorksheetCollection.
member.param: The sheet to remove from the WorksheetCollection. The sheet can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.WorksheetCollection.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the worksheet at the specified index of the WorksheetCollection. If the specific sheet is the last sheet,after removes sheet,will add a new sheet to the WorksheetCollection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the worksheet to remove.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.WorksheetCollection.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the worksheet by the specified sheetName. If the specific sheet is the last sheet,after removes sheet,will add a new sheet to the WorksheetCollection.
member.param: The name of the worksheet to remove.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.WorksheetCollection.IndexOf(Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.Worksheet)
member.summary: Searches for the specified sheet and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire WorksheetCollection.
member.param: The sheet to locate in the WorksheetCollection. The sheet can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.WorksheetCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the worksheet at the specified index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.WorksheetCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the worksheet by the specified name.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridDesktop.WorksheetCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the WorksheetCollection instance.
